definition: marked by skill in deception, a trowel used to make a surface slick, give a smooth and glossy appearance
details:
adjective
- marked by skill in deception
= synonyms: cunning
- having a smooth, gleaming surface reflecting light
= synonyms: satiny, sleek, silken, silky, silklike
- having only superficial plausibility
= synonyms: pat
- made slick by e.g. ice or grease
= example: made slick by e.g. ice or grease
noun
- a trowel used to make a surface slick
- a film of oil or garbage floating on top of water
- a slippery smoothness
= example: a slippery smoothness
= synonyms: slip
- a magazine printed on good quality paper
= synonyms: glossy, slick magazine
verb
- give a smooth and glossy appearance
= example: give a smooth and glossy appearance
= synonyms: slick down, sleek down
- make slick or smooth
= synonyms: sleek
